newsitem.title: UK: Gencor said mulling London float.
newsitem.headline: Gencor said mulling London float.

text.p: South African mining giant Gencor Ltd is planning to float a new mining group on the London Stock Exchange which could be worth up to one billion pounds ($1.6 billion), a British Sunday newspaper reported.

The Observer said the new group would be built around mining subsidiary Billiton International and would also embrace large parts of Gencor's non-South African operations which mine gold, patinum, copper, zinc and tin. It said the flotation, scheduled to take place before the end of the year, was the first step by Gencor since the collapse of apartheid to take on rival Anglo American Corp of South Africa Ltd.

It said the move would also give Gencor a flexible offshore vehicle for the first time and give it a better chance of competing with British-based RTZ Corp Plc and Australia's Broken Hill Proprietary Co Ltd.
It was not immediately possible to contact Gencor for comment on the reports.
